Message.Title: Conservatives are on their last leg in denying MMGW
Message.Msg: The temperature rise in unassailable. No similar temperature rise has manifest in 2000 years of reconstructed climate. The rise correlates well with CO2 as theory predicts. The existence of other driving factors cannot be used to deny MMGW as their presence has not prior created any similar rise. Minor dips and rises are due to other factors that are unknown but are statistically known from the prior temp reconstructions of the past 2000 years. The science is settled CO2 is warming our planet, all we need to do is communicate the scientific results to the public and then let them decide if they want to ruin their children's environment.

Message.Title: Mitt Romney's crippling Olympics neurosis
Message.Msg: "You've heard this voice before. It is the voice of a comically self-satisfied man basking in the glory of achieving something very few mortals would be capable of -- in this case, running a successful Olympic Games. Indeed, Romney would have you believe that he didn't just make the Salt Lake City games a success -- he saved the Olympics themselves. He grabbed ahold of an Olympic torch extinguished by international scandal and relit the flame. That is the unembarrassed message of Romney's 2004 book "Turnaround: Crisis, Leadership, and the Olympic Games." Romney's Olympic triumph is what made the difference (at least in Romney's mind) between his failed 1994 Senate campaign and his successful 2002 gubernatorial bid, which put him on the path to the White House. It is, today, a significant part of Romney's argument for electing him president." http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-215_162-57481378/mitt-romneys-crippling-olympics-neurosis/?tag=cbsnewsSectionContent.13

Message.Title: Inconvenient truths about our national debt
Message.Msg: 1.) The amount by which the public debt — the portion of the national debt not borrowed by the U.S. government from funds it administers — has increased since President Obama took office is unprecedented, not politics as usual: more than $4.75 trillion (more than 75%), according to the Treasury Department. If the president’s second-term budget is implemented, he will end up (according to the Congressional Budget Office) increasing the public debt by $8.9 trillion. That exceeds the public debt incurred by all previous presidents combined — by more than $2.6 trillion. 2.) Large as the public debt is, it doesn’t include amounts the government has promised to pay but lacks the funds to pay. For example, the Social Security and Medicare trustees have estimated that we need more than $63 trillion right now to make promised payments for Social Security and Medicare benefits not covered by current Social Security and Medicare taxes. Read more: http://dailycaller.com/2012/07/27/ten-inconvenient-truths-about-the-national-debt/#ixzz22EKUOEFi

Message.Title: More BS from this administration/are u kidding me?
Message.Msg: Obama backs race-based school discipline policies Published: 1:18 AM 07/27/2012 By Neil Munro President Barack Obama is backing a controversial campaign by progressives to regulate schools’ disciplinary actions so that members of major racial and ethnic groups are penalized at equal rates, regardless of individuals’ behavior. His July 26 executive order established a government panel to promote “a positive school climate that does not rely on methods that result in disparate use of disciplinary tools.” “African Americans lack equal access to highly effective teachers and principals, safe schools, and challenging college-preparatory classes, and they disproportionately experience school discipline,” said the order, titled “White House Initiative On Educational Excellence.” Read more: http://dailycaller.com/2012/07/27/obama-backs-race-based-school-discipline-policies/#ixzz22EWEftaX
